citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
The written program of veterinary care provided by the facility did not include the plan for the goats and sheep. The facility
has consulted with different veterinarians on care for the animals when they were unwell, as was the case with the 8-year-
old Nubian goat with a pre-existing condition, however, did not establish a complete care plan with the current attending
veterinarian. Without a fully developed care plan and without full oversight by the attending veterinarian, animal health
and well-being cannot be assured. In conjunction with the attending veterinarian, the facility must establish program of
adequate veterinary care for the hoof stock that include a plan for animals with chronic conditions, as well as other
aspects of care such as parasite control, vaccinations and methods to prevent, control, diagnose as well as treat
diseases/injuries. If needed, the attending Veterinarian may consult with and advise Licensee to seek care from other
veterinarians with regard to some health issues. Correct by March 29, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.40(a)(1) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
The written program of veterinary care provided by the facility did not include the plan for the goats and sheep. The facility 
has consulted with different veterinarians on care for the animals when they were unwell, as was the case with the 8-year-
old Nubian goat with a pre-existing condition, however, did not establish a complete care plan with the current attending 
veterinarian. Without a fully developed care plan and without full oversight by the attending veterinarian, animal health 
and well-being cannot be assured. In conjunction with the attending veterinarian, the facility must establish program of 
adequate veterinary care for the hoof stock that include a plan for animals with chronic conditions, as well as other 
aspects of care such as parasite control, vaccinations and methods to prevent, control, diagnose as well as treat 
diseases/injuries. If needed, the attending Veterinarian may consult with and advise Licensee to seek care from other 
veterinarians with regard to some health issues. Correct by March 29, 2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
